name: The Goring

reviews.text: .On arrival, we were given lashings of attention, in spite of this hotel being very busy on a saturday afternoon. There were at least four 'front of house' people checking us in, and dazzling us with helpfulness and much conversation. We were overwhlemed. This distraction must have been the reason why they took my credit card details twice in the tiny quaint room behind the front desk. We did find our room particularly small, and crowded. The food, both dinner and breakfast were satisfactory. However the final bill which was taken from my credit card, included an extra amount of over £3000; this was taken out of my account on three ocassions during the week when I was on the Orient Express. This I was informed was a mistake, which caused me great stress and consternation, not to mind loosing time at work and money ringing International numbers in order to sort the mess out. That type of mistake is not 5 star administration, nor is the casual way in which they handled the matter. I could not in all sincerity recommend this hotel to anyone, nor would I return..
reviews.title: 'Beware' and avoid before this 'friendly serpent's egg hatches', as it 'would grow mischievous', when least expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were planning a trip to London to watch Fleetwood Mac at Wembley and we spent so much time looking for hotels, checking out reviews and were still un-decided so in the end booked a 'secret hotel' and ended up with The Goring. To be honest we would probably never have chosen this one just from reviews and may have thought it stuffy and too 'old school, but we now realise from our stay how wrong we would have been and how lucky we were to stay here.
reviews.title: Elegant but not stuffy, helpful but not over-bearing, absolutely loved it

reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we were met with very friendly, helpful and very smartly dressed staff. We were shown up to our room and the history of the hotel was explained, as well as the history of the sheep. The staff truly are a credit to the hotel.
reviews.title: It was wonderful
Quintessential London
reviews.text: Bathroom was spotless, it was marble tiled, fab shower and bath and Molten Brown toiletries.The bed was one of the comfiest ever, had a great sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never ate in the hotel as we already had plans, but saw fabulous afternoon tea and we did sample the cocktails, which were really good.
reviews.title: Loved it! Can't wait to go back.

reviews.text: I only stayed a night as I couldn't get into the Lanesborough, following this ash fiasco. Thoroughly lovely in every way. My new London 1st choice of hotel.
reviews.title: So Pleased this sort of Hotel still exists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having travelled extensively thoruhgout the UK and overseas, it is a pleasure to stay in a quintessentialy British hotel. The Goring retains all the charm and grandeur of a traditional hotel while having all the facilities and services you would expect in 2010.
reviews.title: Glorious, Stylish, Central, Everything a Hotel Should Be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all efficient, attentive and friendly (something often lacking from 5 * hotels).
reviews.title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was stunning with superb facilities, we dined in our room TWICE during the stay, once taking afternoon tea which was sublime.
reviews.title: A calm, welcoming oasis in central London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was leisurely and delicious.
reviews.title: Experience the 'special' factor
Wanted to like it.....
reviews.text: The Goring sounded like the perfect hotel for us. We love traditional, old-line British hotels. However, for us, the Goring just was not up to snuff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, we had reservation issues upon check-in, which took quite a while to resolve. There was a lengthy failure to acknowledge, by the staff, that we had not been given the category of room which was shown on our reservation. This, despite a number of conversations on the matter! In addition, we did not receive a king sized bed, which was also what we had booked. I finally had to measure the bed to settle the matter. I would be very cautious in confirming that your reservation will be honored as written on your reservation confirmation. I have really not ever had to argue the point to the extent that I had to at the Goring.
reviews.title: A real old fashioned British hotel

reviews.text: In addition, our initial rooms were quite dowdy, and in need of a refurbishment. Not terrible, but small, and really almost depressing. We were finally moved, after MUCH discussion, and our new rooms were quite a bit better, but we were not paying the rack rate price on these, although the hotel had certainly tried to get me to pay for the upgrade....even though they had failed to give me the type of room and bed which we had reserved. I would say that the beds and quality of furnishing, even in our upgraded rooms, were not what you would expect in this price range, even in London. There was a very cheap looking desk in our room, and the beds were really quite soft, and not in a good way. Also, towels were worn looking in comparison to those at top London hotels.
reviews.title: Great and very friendly service

reviews.text: I should also mention the elevator at the Goring. It was out at least a couple of times during our stay. I mean, inoperable for hours at a time. One guest was stuck in it for a substantial amount of time, and this did not seem like a new experience for staff. The main elevator at the Goring is not large, but it is adequate. The secondary elevator does not hold more than a couple of well-acquainted people. We ended up walking to our room most of the time, and we were located towards the top of the hotel. It didn't really bother me as I like to get a lot of exercise, but this might be an issue for some people.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service, Great Location - you will not be disappointed

reviews.text: Another aspect of the Goring that I did not like was it's apparent lack of a sprinkler system. I realize that it is an old hotel, but I would like to see this situation resolved, expecially in a hotel which has aspirations to being one of the top hotels in London.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this hotel, faultless, first class.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't say enough nice things about our stay at The Goring. When we go back to London we will not consider another hotel. We could not have been treated better from the moment we arrived until the momment we left. We rate the hotel excellent in all areas-room, staff, lobby, reataurant/bar, location and service.
reviews.title: We loved this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A brief visit, but 3 days of pure luxury that did us the world of good. Really friendly staff in the restaurant and on the Front Desk. A hotel with great attention to detail. Very friendly and attentive management team too.
reviews.title: Wonderful
Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: This is a truly great hotel. Lovely rooms. Friendly staff. Great location. For summer travel, US class air conditioning. Stayed 7 nights and enjoyed every moment of the visit. Nice dining room.

I took my first ever trip to London this past April. As a birthday splurge for myself - I wanted an old elegant hotel with some history. The Goring did not disappoint. In fact - my stay at the Goring was by far the most wonderful hotel experience I've ever had in my life. The hotel itself is beautiful, the beds are a dream, there are towel warmers in the bathrooms and Afternoon Tea is delicious. But the service is second to none. I've never had such service; they were always anticipating my needs before I realized them myself. I mentioned in passing to the concierge one morning that I was thinking about visiting Hampton Court. When I returned to the front desk later to get my key - they had printed out maps and visitor information for Hampton Court. Another morning - while having breakfast in their gorgeous dining room - I saw one of the wait staff approaching me from across the room, unfolding a napkin. I thought that was odd since I already had a napkin. Then I glanced down and noticed that my napkin had fallen to the floor. I hadn't even realized it. But the wait staff had noticed before I did and was bringing me another one! Seriously! Who does that? That is the kind of attention you can expect at The Goring. And the location was perfect. If one turns left out the hotel and travels about a block - you'll soon see Victoria Station. If one turns right and goes to the end of the street - you'll be walking along the walls of Buckingham Palace. It was so easy to get every where. I wish everyone could experience The Goring. I am already planning how I can return again soon.
reviews.title: The Goring Hotel: Pure Bliss

reviews.text: I went to London the first week of May on a business trip. My plane arrived from the States 1 hour earlier than my scheduled arrival and I arrived at the airport at 5:30am. I was picked up at the Heathrow Airport and arrived at the Goring at 6:45am. I was greeted warmly at the front door and to my pleasant suprise I was given a room right away and I was taking a nap by 7:15am. That set the tone that everything was to go right on this trip and that the Hotel staff did everything it possibly could for you. The room was clean and bigger than the usual London Hotel. The warm bathroom floor and warming rack for the towels was a great touch. I had book the room online directly with the hotel and I paid $250 a night which was a great bargain for the class of the Hotel. The location was great, next to Victoria train station, Buckingham Palace and many other sights and restaurants that were within walking distance. When I go back to London I will defintely stay here again.
reviews.title: Early Check In Set the Tone

description: Today, The Goring is regarded the favourite address for anyone looking for the quintessentially English hotel in the heart of London. A hotel where every member of the team takes terrific pride in offering the highest levels of personal service, where guests are sincerely welcomed and can enjoy elegant individual accommodations, the tranquillity of its own private Gardens, and the utterly splendid Lounge Bar and Dining Room where the very best of British food and been celebrated for over a century. With just 69 rooms and suites The Goring is truly a “Baby Grand”, the finest of hotels in the perfect location but with the most intimate of atmospheres and personalised attention.The Goring has been serving its quintessentially English Afternoon Tea since the day the hotel opened in 1910 and after 103 years, has mastered the perfect menu - with everything from deliciously traditional British brews, to tea-leaves sourced from the foot of the Himalayas. Such excellence has resulted in The Goring’s Afternoon Tea being awarded with one of the highest accolades from the UK Tea Guild, The 2013 Top London Afternoon Tea Award.
